_header: Why is this world beloved that false is and vain

BodLauMis23.First Lines:
Whi is the word belouyd that fals is and veynSithyn that hise
                    welthis ben vncerteynAl so sone slidith his power awayAs dooth a broke
                    pot that fressh is and gay…
BodLauMis23.Last Lines:
…But for als moche as a man shal dye at the lasteIt is no
                    worshipe but a charge lordshipe to taaste
BodLauMis23.Note:
Preceded by Latin, Gangere qui gaudes meretricem qualiter audes hoc
                        in decretis / Palmis pollutis regem tractare salutis (f.
                    112v).
BodLauMis23.Editions:
Gray,  Douglas,
                        ed.  
             A Selection of Religious Lyrics.
Clarendon Medieval and Tudor Series.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1975: 89.

CamTCC181.First Lines:
Whi is þe world biloued þat fals in is &
                    veinsiþen þat is hise welþis ben
                    vncerteinAlso soone slideþ his power awayas doiþ a brokil
                    pot þat freche freisch is and gay…
CamTCC181.Last Lines:
…But for as miche aman muste die at þe lasteit is no
                    worschip but acharge lordschip to taste
CamTCC181.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XIV Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1924. 2nd ed., rev.: G. V. Smithers, Oxford,
            1952: 237-9.
Davies,  Reginald Thorne. 
             Medieval English Lyrics: a critical anthology.
         London, 1963; Evanston, IL: Northwestern UP, 1964: 173-5.

BLAdd37788.First Lines:
Whi is þe world biloued þat fals is & veynSiþe
                    þat his welpis ben vncertein…
BLAdd37788.Last Lines:
…But for as muche as a man muste die at þe lasteit is no
                    worschip but a charge lordschip to taste

BLCottTitCXIX.First Lines:
WHy is the worlde belouede that fals is & veynSithen his
                    welthes ben so vncerteyn…
BLCottTitCXIX.Last Lines:
…But for as muche a man must deye atte lastIt is no worshpe
                    but a charge lordshipe to taste

BLHar1706.First Lines: Whye ys þe worlde byloued þat ys fals and veynesyþen þat hys welþis been vncerteyne…
BLHar1706.Last Lines: …But for as myche as a man muste deye at þe lasteyt ys no worschype but a charge lordschype to caste
BLHar1706.Note: Second occurrence in MS. Written as prose.
BLHar1706.Attributed Title: þis sentence seiþ seynte Austyne (rubric preceding first line, f. 150rb)
BLHar1706.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Harley MS 1706.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?index=0&ref=Harley_MS_1706.
BLHar1706.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             Yorkshire Writers.
         2 vols. London, Sonnenschein; New York: Macmillan, 1895-96: 2.374-75.

Lam853.First Lines:
Whi is þis world biloued þat fals is & veynSiþen
                    þat hise welþis be so vnserteyn…
Lam853.Last Lines:
…It were ful ioieful & sweete lorschipe to haueIf so
                    þat lorschip miȝte aman fro deeþ saueBut for as myche as a
                    man schal deie at þe lasteIt is noo worschip but a charge lordschip to
                    taaste
Lam853.Attributed Title:
Omnia terrena. Per vices sunt aliena nescio sunt anus mea nunc. cras
                        huius et huius Dic homo quid speres. li mundo totus adheres nulla tecum
                        feres. licet tu solis haberes (p. 35, rubric)
